Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a specific habitat, such as a garden or forest, using appropriate features such as trees and water areas.
The student can draw a variety of plants found in the chosen habitat, including trees, grasses, and bushes, and can label them correctly most of the time.
The student can draw a diverse range of animals in the habitat, such as squirrels, ants, and birds, and can show them interacting realistically with the environment.
The student can attempt to illustrate diversity by drawing another habitat with different sets of living things and generally notes differences.
CANNOT: The student may sometimes omit smaller details or not include all types of plants and animals, leading to incomplete diversity representation (e.g., missing small insects).
The student might inconsistently label plants and animals, occasionally omitting labels or mislabeling a few organisms.
The student might show some patterns of plants and animals across habitats, but could miss subtle patterns or interactions (e.g., food chains).
